meanings.definition: A small box or container for holding precious items
meanings.sent1: She carefully placed the delicate necklace in the caddices.
meanings.sent2: The jewelry store displayed various caddices for rings and earrings.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten thought the caddices was a perfect hiding spot for its toy mouse.
meanings.sent4: Her heart was a caddices of memories, each one precious and irreplaceable.
meanings.sent5: The caddices gleamed in the sunlight, revealing its hidden treasures.

meanings.sent1: The caddices on the dress sparkled under the lights.
meanings.sent2: The antique mirror had intricate caddices along its edges.
meanings.sent3: The Christmas tree was adorned with colorful caddices that shimmered in the room.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like a caddices, adding joy to the dull room.
meanings.sent5: The caddices on the crown made the queen look even more regal.

meanings.definition: A small bundle or package of items
meanings.sent1: She carried a caddices of flowers to the party.
meanings.sent2: The vendor handed out caddices of samples to the customers.
meanings.sent3: The children eagerly opened the caddices of candies they received.
meanings.sent4: His words were a caddices of wisdom that he shared with his students.
meanings.sent5: The caddices of books on the shelf tempted her to start reading.
